Package infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian

Class SInfoCalculatorGaussian

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorCommon
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian.MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorGaussian
        • infodynamics.measures.continuous.gaussian.SInfoCalculatorGaussian
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
    public class SInfoCalculatorGaussian
extends MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorGaussian

    Computes the differential S-information of a given multivariate double[][] set of observations (extending MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorGaussian), assuming that the probability distribution function for these observations is a multivariate Gaussian distribution.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorCommon.

    References:

    • Rosas, F., Mediano, P., Gastpar, M, Jensen, H., "Quantifying high-order interdependencies via multivariate extensions of the mutual information", Physical Review E 100, (2019) 032305.
    Author:
    Pedro A.M. Mediano (email, www)

    • Method Detail

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        public double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the average value of the measure from the previously-supplied samples.
        Returns:
        the average S-info in nats (not bits!)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if not sufficient data have been provided, or if the supplied covariance matrix is invalid.

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations​(double[][] states)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the local measure values for each of the supplied samples in states.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations, but not those in states (unless they were some of the previously supplied samples).

        Specified by:
        computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations in class MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorCommon
        Parameters:
        states - series of multivariate observations (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        Returns:
        the "time-series" of local S-info values in nats (not bits!) for the supplied states.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if not sufficient data have been provided, or if the supplied covariance matrix is invalid.
